history.content:
The phase 1.5 cap will be the same as phase 1. The intention of this phase is to allow students to make adjustments after learning more about what format & when classes will be held, not add more classes just yet.

Phase 2 will be mere days after phase 1.5 and the unit cap will increase then.

children.subject:
You should have gotten an email about it. If not,

Dear Students,

In response to UC Berkeley's plan to offer remote and in-person classes this fall, Phase 1 of enrollment will re-open to continuing students.

Undergraduate appointments will take place on July 8 and 9 and remain open until July 11 at 11:59PM.

Graduate appointments will take place on July 10 and remain open until July 13.

Beginning on July 5 at 6PM, you can check CalCentral for the specific start and end time of your appointment which will appear as Phase 1.5. Times are listed in Pacific Daylight Time (PDT). The 13.5 unit limit (including waitlist) for undergraduates and 12 unit limit (including waitlist) for graduate students still apply.

history.content: What will be the unit cap for the extended Phase 1 (1.5)? Will it be the same as Phase 1 (13.5 units)? Or will the consider increasing the unit cap?
history.subject: Phase 1.5 unit cap
